comments.body:
Include a `host=kwargs[Jail.modified_jailname_key]` kwarg when calling `display.vvv`.

This will maintain consistency with other calls to `display.vvv` made by the `Jail` connection plugin.
Wouldn't it be helpful in terms of error tracing to use the initial iocage tag (i.e. `self.ioc_jail`) instead of the already converted jail uuid for `host`?

That would be ideal, as long as you maintain the log entry you already have to indicate the mapping between the two.

You'll need to update the `Jail` plugin so there's a separate `self.jail_friendly_name` or something similar which is used for the `host` passed to `display.vvv`, so you're able to show the iocage jail name on all the messages from the underlying `Jail` plugin.
Hm, I meant in that particular place in `iocage.py` only. I think trying to pass that down to `jail.py` could get confusing quickly and kind of blurs the edges of the two connectors.

It's important to have the same `host` kwarg value used for all calls to `display.vvv` for the same connection, whether that be the actual jail name or the iocage jail name.

As written currently, the `display.vvv` call above is simply lacking the `host` kwarg. It can be added without making any changes to the message displayed.
Oh, okay. If it has to be the same throughout the connection, then I guess using the actual jail name is the most sensible approach

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +46,50 @@        kwargs[Jail.modified_jailname_key] = 'ioc-{}'.format(jail_uuid)

        display.vvv(u"Jail {iocjail} has been translated to {rawjail}".format(
            iocjail=self.ioc_jail, rawjail=kwargs[Jail.modified_jailname_key]),
            host=kwargs[Jail.modified_jailname_key])
